hook.text: AI can write a news article in seconds. If machines make the news, who decides what's newsworthy?

buildup.text: AI tools already write financial reports, sports summaries, and basic news articles for major outlets.

discovery.text: AI-generated content could flood the internet with plausible-sounding articles that no human wrote or verified.

twist.text: AI writing can be biased based on its training data. It amplifies existing patterns rather than questioning them.

climax.text: If readers can't distinguish human from AI journalism, trust in all media erodes further.

punchline.text: AI writes news faster than humans. It just can't tell truth from fiction.

quiz.question: What is a major risk of AI-generated news?
options: Plausible-sounding articles that no human wrote or verified could flood the internet
AI always produces perfectly accurate journalism
AI-generated content is easy for readers to identify
